t: Isaiah 21
A Judgment on Babylon
A*p pronouncement concerning the desert by the sea: Like*pn storms that pass over the Negev, it*ln comes from the desert, from the land of terror.
A*ln troubling vision is declared to me: “The*ln treacherous one acts treacherously, and*ln the destroyer destroys. Advance,*ln Elam! Lay siege, you Medes! I*ln will put an end to all the groaning.”
Therefore*ln I am filled with anguish. Pain*ln grips me, like the pain of a woman in labor. I*ln am too perplexed to hear, too*ln dismayed to see.
My*ln heart staggers; horror*ln terrifies me. He*ln has turned my last glimmer of hope into*ln sheer terror.
Prepare*ln a table, and spread out a carpet! Eat*ln and drink! Rise*ln up, you princes, and oil the shields!
For*ln the Lord has said to me, “Go,*ln post a lookout; let*ln him report what he sees.
When*ln he sees riders — pairs*ln of horsemen, riders*ln on donkeys, riders*ln on camels — he*ln must pay close attention.”
Then*ln the lookout reported, “Lord,*ln I stand on the watchtower all day, and*ln I stay at my post all night.
Look,*ln riders come — horsemen*ln in pairs.” And*ln he answered, saying, “Babylon*ln has fallen, has fallen. All*ln the images of her gods have*ln been shattered on the ground.”
My*ln people who have been crushed on*ln the threshing floor, I*ln have declared to you what*ln I have heard from the Lord*s of Armies, the*ln God of Israel.
A Pronouncement against Dumah
A*p pronouncement concerning Dumah: One*pn calls to me from Seir, “Watchman,*ln what is left of the night? Watchman,*ln what is left of the night?”
The*ln watchman said, “Morning*ln has come, and also night. If*ln you want to ask, ask! Come*ln back again.”
A Pronouncement against Arabia
A*p pronouncement concerning Arabia: In*pn the desert brush you*ln will camp for the night, you*ln caravans of Dedanites.
Bring*ln water for the thirsty. The*ln inhabitants of the land of Tema meet*ln the refugees with food.
For*ln they have fled from swords, from*ln the drawn sword, from*ln the bow that is strung, and*ln from the stress of battle.
For*p the Lord said this to me: “Within one year, as a hired worker counts years, all the glory of Kedar will be gone.
The remaining Kedarite archers will be few in number.” For the Lord,*s the God of Israel, has spoken.
